Name: April 2024 Newsletter
Content:
Spring Into Action This April at Gardens on Quail!

As we welcome the blooming flowers and warmer days of April, Gardens on Quail is buzzing with excitement and a fantastic lineup of events. From the start of the baseball season to our delightful "Springtime in Paris" week, there's something for everyone to enjoy. So, put on your spring attire, gather your friends, and let's make this month unforgettable!

Upcoming Events

Rockies Opening Day Party

  • Date: April 5th
  • Time: 1:30 pm

Celebrate the start of the baseball season with your community at our Rockies Opening Day Party! It's the perfect occasion to enjoy the game, mingle with fellow residents, and indulge in some baseball-themed snacks.

Solar Eclipse Party

  • Date: April 8th
  • Time: 12:30 pm

Join us for a mesmerizing Solar Eclipse Party. Experience this astronomical event with your neighbors, equipped with safe viewing glasses and guided by experts.

Employee Appreciation Week

  • Dates: April 15th - 19th

A week-long celebration to honor the hard work and dedication of our staff. It's our way of saying thank you for their continual efforts in making Gardens on Quail a warm and welcoming place.

Memory Care Lunch Outing to Randy's Pizza

  • Date: April 16th
  • Time: 11:30 am

Our Memory Care residents are invited for a delightful lunch outing at Randy's Pizza. It's a great opportunity for a change of scenery and to enjoy some delicious pizza.

AL/IL Outing to Black Hawk

  • Date: April 17th
  • Time: 10:30 am - 2:00 pm

A fun excursion to Black Hawk is planned for our Assisted Living and Independent Living residents. Remember to sign up at the desk by April 15th to join in on the adventure.

"Springtime in Paris" Week

  • Dates: April 22nd - 26th

Immerse yourself in the charm of Paris this spring without leaving our community. Enjoy a week filled with French-inspired events, activities, and cuisine.

Dementia Support Group

  • Date: May 7th
  • Time: 4:00 pm

Facilitated by our Regional Memory Care Director, Marci Gerke, this group offers a space for support, advice, and shared experiences for those caring for loved ones with dementia.

Welcome New Residents

A warm welcome to Kenneth Zeitlow, Ann Wilson, Hugh and Monica Norwood, Myra Salbato, and Barbara Hufford. We're excited to have you join our community!

Employee Appreciation: Quail Cash

Remember to show your appreciation to our staff with "Quail Cash," which they can redeem for various prizes, including a paid day off.

Employee of the Month

Congratulations to Barry Borden, our April Employee of the Month! Barry's positive energy and team spirit are truly inspiring to us all.

April Birthdays

Join us in celebrating the birthdays of our residents and staff. From Stan Wilkes and Louise Hardesty to our staff members Jennie Dreiling and Doreen Culhane, let's make their special days memorable.

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: April 25 Newsletter
Content:
Spring into April at Gardens on Quail!

Welcome to our April newsletter where community, creativity, and connection bloom!

Celebrating Our Community Stars

This month, we're thrilled to spotlight Lindsey Reed, our exceptional evening cook in the dining department. Lindsey's passion for "service with a smile" and willingness to embrace new challenges makes her an invaluable team member. Her dedication shines through as she supports both residents and staff. Thank you, Lindsey, for making every meal special!

April Birthdays

We're celebrating several special birthdays this month:

  • Carrie Louise H. - 4th
  • Ruth Ann S. - 9th
  • Bruce D. - 12th
  • Elizabeth W. - 15th
  • Loyd Blaine H. - 20th
  • James G. - 27th
  • Stuart O. - 29th
  • Donald J. - 30th

Join us in wishing them a wonderful celebration!

Community Connections

Our community thrives on connection! Ladies, join us for Coffee Klatch every Tuesday morning at 9:30am in the Private Dining Room. Gentlemen, our Brew Buds Men's Club meets every Monday at 4pm in the Private Dining Room.

Creativity Corner

April brings exciting creative opportunities:

  • Dreamcatcher Workshop with Vera on Friday, April 18th at 1:30pm
  • Glass Bead Art Project with Vera on Friday, April 25th at 1:30pm
  • Jewelry Making with Marilyn returns on Wednesday, April 16th at 2pm

All creative sessions take place in Town Center!

Making a Difference

Help us make a positive impact in our community:

  • Assist with painting mini houses for our courtyard model railroad (April 9th and 16th at 11am)
  • Join our lunch bag decoration session for people in need (Saturday, April 12th at 1:30pm)
  • Help fill lunch bags for distribution (Saturday, April 19th at 1:30pm)

Musical Entertainment

Every Friday at 3pm, unwind at our Happy Hour featuring tasty treats, refreshing drinks, and live music! This month's performers include:

  • April 4th: Rick Chinisci and Charlie Duo
  • April 11th: Dino on Drums
  • April 18th: Roz Brown
  • April 25th: Leonard Barrett

Adventures Await

Our April outings calendar is packed with excitement:

  • Wednesday, April 2nd: Shopping at ARC Thrift Store (1:30pm)
  • Thursday, April 17th: Lunch at Amici's Pizzeria (11am)
  • Wednesday, April 23rd: Shopping at Homestead Antiques Mall (1:30pm)
  • Thursday, April 24th: Lunch at Kona Hawaiian BBQ (11am)
  • Wednesday, April 30th: Memory Care trip to Breadwinners (11am)

Movie Nights

We've expanded our movie offerings this month! Stop by the front desk to pick up the complete movie schedule, including our new Wednesday night documentary series.

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Content:
December Newsletter: The Gardens on Quail

Upcoming Events:

  • December 5: Meet & Greet with EmpowerMe Therapy, 2:00 pm
  • December 12: Christmas Tea Party, 2:30 pm
  • December 13: Blanket Making for a Cause, 1:30 pm

Resident Birthdays:

  • December 5: Jo Moran
  • December 13: Joan Tipton

  • December 28: Assunta DeVito

Staff Birthdays:

  • December 12: Trevor Harwood

  • December 24: Marc Ekberg
  • December 30: Aundraya Lewis

Special Thanks:

‍As the holiday season approaches, we express our gratitude for your trust in The Gardens on Quail. While we uphold a no-tipping policy, we acknowledge our employees' commitment and invite contributions to the Employee Holiday Fund. Kindly make checks payable to "The Gardens on Quail," noting "Employee Holiday Fund" in the memo, and submit them at the front desk by December 31, 2023. Your generosity directly appreciates our team's dedication.

Holiday Employee Fund:

‍Join us for the Christmas meal on December 22, 12 pm, in the Memory and main dining rooms. Family members are welcome at $25 per guest. Please RSVP by December 17.

Welcome New Residents:

‍Linda Bouffard and Dennis Seabourn

Community Engagement:

‍Our heartfelt thanks to everyone who participated in the Thanksgiving meal, especially the Northglenn Baseball Team volunteers. We're adopting families this holiday season to support Crisalida Inc., aiding communities affected by trauma and domestic violence. Join us by selecting a gift tag from the tree in our foyer to fulfill their wishes.

Adopt A Family

As part of our ongoing effort to serve our community we are adopting a few families for theHoliday Season. We have a tree with gift tags In the foyer. Please feel free to help us fulfill the families gift list. We are supporting the organization Crisalida Inc who support underserved communities that are facing trauma and domestic violence.

‍

Author: mariah-ruell

Name: December 24 Newsletter
Content:
The holiday season is a magical time, and we at Gardens on Quail have an incredible lineup of festive events to bring joy, connection, and cheer to our community! From dazzling performances to heartwarming traditions, there's something for everyone to enjoy this December.

🎁 December Events to Remember

  • December 2nd, 3:00 PM: Curious Dragon Presentation: The Path of Polar Bears 🐻‍❄️

  • Joan W. (Dec 20)

🌟 Employee Spotlight

Congratulations to Abby, our Employee of the Month! Abby’s exceptional dedication to providing top-notch dining experiences has truly brightened our residents’ days. Thank you, Abby, for going above and beyond!

🎄 Giving Tree Initiative

This December, we’re supporting Crisálida, an organization providing resources and support for individuals facing trauma, domestic violence, and abuse. Visit our Giving Tree at the front kiosk starting December 1st to participate.

🎶 Weekly Happy Hour Performances

Every Friday at 3 PM, unwind with live music, tasty treats, and refreshing drinks!

  • December 13th: Leonard

🎅 Save the Date: Christmas Eve Breakfast

We’re thrilled to invite families for a special Christmas Eve Breakfast on December 24th, 7:30 - 10:00 AM. Tickets are $18—RSVP by December 18th at the front desk.

Join us for a holiday season to remember at Gardens on Quail, where community and cheer shine brightest!

Author: mariah-ruell

Name: February 2024 Newsletter
Content:
As we step into February, Gardens on Quail is brimming with excitement and activities to warm your heart this winter. From our inaugural Men's Breakfast Club to a delightful Girl Scout Cookie Sale, and a special visit from miniature horses, there's something for everyone. Join us in celebrating community spirit, fun events, and meaningful connections throughout the month.

Let's make February a month of joy and togetherness!

Upcoming Events:

  • February 6, 8:00 am: Men's Breakfast Club - Our inaugural gathering.
  • February 7, 3:30 pm: Girl Scout Troop 67389 Cookie Sale.
  • February 11, 4:00 pm: Super Bowl Party.
  • February 13, 10:00 am: Miniature Horse Visit.
  • February 14, 6:00 pm: SheElvis Performance.
  • February 21, 1:30 pm: Mary Kay Piano Performance.
  • February 26, 1:30 pm: Gardens on Quail Pie Bake-Off.

Family Support Group:

‍At the Gardens on Quail, we understand the challenges and emotions involved in supporting a loved one with dementia. We're excited to offer a support group for families and friends, providing a space for sharing, learning, and connecting. Topics will include coping mechanisms, understanding dementia progression, and effective communication strategies. Join us every other Friday at 1 PM in the chapel to find support and understanding in a compassionate community.

Welcome New Residents:

  • Joan Scott
  • Joyce Lybargee
  • James Konrad

Gardens on Quail Pie Bake-Off:

‍Join us on February 26 for our neighborhood and staff Pie Bake-Off! Your presence and palate are requested at 1:30 pm in the town center to help judge and pick the winning pie.

Thank You:

‍A heartfelt thanks to everyone who contributed supplies for The Family Tree bags. Our MLK project positively impacted 40 individuals experiencing homelessness.

Resident Birthdays:

  • February 3: Allen Christner
  • February 6: Armalee Axmacher and Mary Wood
  • February 8: Marlene Zimmerman
  • February 14: Timothy Adams and Anita Jennison
  • February 17: Frank Leonard
  • February 29: Ruth Kaufman

Staff Birthdays:

  • February 2: Keiry Castelan
  • February 6: Leisel Strahm
  • February 8: Belicia Peters

Author: mariah-ruell

Name: February 25 Newsletter
Content:
Love, Laughter, and Lots of Fun! 🌷

February is here, and we’re ready to celebrate love, community, and exciting events all month long at Gardens on Quail! From delicious Valentine’s treats to Super Bowl festivities, there’s something for everyone to enjoy.

🎉 Resident Birthdays – Let’s Celebrate!

A very HAPPY BIRTHDAY to our wonderful residents! 🎂

🎈 Mary W. & Ann M. – February 6
🎈 Tony K. – February 7
🎈 Marlene Z. – February 8

We hope your day is filled with love, joy, and, of course, cake!

🌟 Employee of the Month: Anahi

This month, we are thrilled to recognize Anahi as our Employee of the Month! Her kindness, positive energy, and dedication make Gardens on Quail a brighter place for everyone. Whether assisting with care, leading activities, or helping in the dining room, Anahi always goes above and beyond. Thank you, Anahi, for all that you do!

🎊 Exciting Events This February!

📅 Men’s Coffee Klatch ☕ – Every Tuesday at 9:30 AM | Private Dining Room
A great way to start your morning, meet fellow residents, and get to know our new Activities Director, Conor Smallwood!

🍷 Happy Hour – Now with Appetizers! – Every Friday at 3 PM
Enjoy a refreshing drink, a delicious spread of appetizers, and live entertainment!

🎤 Live Music Schedule for Happy Hour:
🎸 February 7th – Rick Chinisci & Charlie
🎶 February 14th – Dino
🎻 February 21st – Kaleidoscope Music Studio
🎹 February 28th – Piano with Scott Hackler

❤️ Valentine’s Tea Party – Tuesday, February 11 | 2:30 PM | Town Center
Join us for an afternoon of tea, sweet treats, and delightful company as we celebrate love and friendship!

🏈 Super Bowl Sunday Party! – Sunday, February 11
Cheer on your favorite team as the Philadelphia Eagles take on the Kansas City Chiefs! Enjoy a game-day feast, including mocktails, wings, homemade chips, dips, and more!

🍕 Lunch Outing to Randi’s Pizza – Thursday, February 13 | 11 AM
Let’s head out for a tasty lunch together! Sign up at the front desk.

🍝 Valentine’s Pasta Bar Lunch – Friday, February 14 | Dining Room
Celebrate love with a delicious pasta lunch, made with care by our amazing dining team.

🍪 Girl Scout Cookie Sale – Friday, February 14 | 2:30 PM | Bistro
A local Girl Scout will be selling cookies—so don’t miss your chance to grab your favorite flavors!

🥯 Tasty Tuesday: Everything Bagels & Cucumber Bites – Tuesday, February 18 | Town Center
Enjoy a savory and refreshing treat to brighten your week!

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Content:

Author: mariah-ruell

Name: January 25 Newsletter
Content:
As we step into 2025, Gardens on Quail is buzzing with activities to keep our community vibrant, engaged, and connected! From live music to creative workshops, there’s something for everyone to enjoy. Here’s a sneak peek into what’s happening this month:

🎶 A Night with the King – January 8th at 6:00 PM

Get ready to rock ‘n’ roll! Join us for an electrifying performance by Elvis himself (or the next best thing). Gather your friends and neighbors for an evening of music, dancing, and nostalgia that’ll have you singing along all night long.

🎨 Arts & Crafts – Mondays at 1:30 PM

Channel your creativity and build meaningful connections! Every Monday, join us for fun arts and crafts sessions that let you express yourself while bonding with your neighbors. Let’s make something beautiful together.

☕ Coffee & Conversation – Tuesdays at 9:30 AM

Start your Tuesdays with a warm cup of coffee and even warmer conversations. Whether it’s catching up with friends or making new ones, this is the perfect way to kick off your day.

♠️ Game Nights – Tuesdays at 6:15 PM

Looking for some friendly competition? Swing by Cinnamon for self-led card and board games. It’s a great way to relax, unwind, and enjoy quality time with your neighbors.

🤔 Wacky Word Games – Wednesdays at 11:00 AM

Laughter is guaranteed at our Wacky Word Games! Get creative, test your wits, and have a blast with your friends. Don’t miss this midweek pick-me-up!

🏋️ EmpowerME Wellness Discussions – Thursdays at 11:00 AM (Starting January 9th)

Let’s talk health, fitness, and wellness! Join EmpowerME for insightful discussions that’ll inspire you to live your best life. A healthier you starts here.

🌺 Flower Arranging – Fridays at 11:15 AM

Brighten up our facility with your artistic touch! Join us to create stunning floral centerpieces that add a touch of elegance to our community.

💪 Saturday Workouts – Saturdays at 10:00 AM

Let’s kickstart the weekend with some fun and fitness! Join our friendly exercise classes to stay active, energized, and ready for whatever the weekend brings.

Celebrate with Us!

Raise a toast to Debbie, our January Employee of the Month! Her positivity, professionalism, and dedication make her an invaluable part of our team. Congratulations, Debbie!

Let’s make 2025 a year to remember. Check your calendar for more exciting activities – there’s something for everyone, and we’d love to see you there! Together, let’s embrace the new year with joy, laughter, and plenty of cherished moments.

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: July 2024 Newsletter
Content:
This month is packed with exciting events, special celebrations, and heartwarming welcomes at Gardens on Quail. Dive into the highlights and join us in making this summer memorable.

Employee of the Month

‍Congratulations to Rickden Tsering, our Employee of the Month for July! Rickden's humble kindness and readiness to help wherever needed make him an invaluable member of our community. Our residents and staff wholeheartedly appreciate you, Rickden!

Upcoming Events‍

Patriotic Show with Dino

Date: July 3rd
Time: 2:00 pm
Celebrate the spirit of Independence Day with a patriotic show by Dino.
‍

Fourth of July Parade

Date: July 4th
Time: 10:00 am
Join us for a festive Fourth of July parade.
‍

Summer Tea Party

Date: July 10th
Time: 2:00 pm
Enjoy a delightful afternoon tea party to celebrate summer.
‍

Meet and Greet with EmpowerMe

Date: July 11th
Time: 1:30 pm
Get to know the EmpowerMe team during this casual meet and greet.
‍

Summer Luau Fundraiser

Date: July 26th
Time: 1:30 pm - 2:00 pm
Mark your calendars for our second annual Alzheimer's Luau event. Enjoy a Hawaiian BBQ and a captivating performance by Tehani's Hula Colorado. Tickets are $35 for guests, with all proceeds benefiting our Alzheimer's Association Fundraiser. Kindly RSVP by July 16th.
‍

July Birthdays Celebration

Date: July 31st
Time: 3:00 pm
Join us in celebrating the birthdays of our wonderful residents.
‍

Welcome New Residents‍

A warm welcome to our newest community members: Carmen Bednarz, Mary Ann Thompson, and Emilie Arnold. We are thrilled to have you with us!

Warm Welcome to Our New Executive Director and Nurse‍

We are excited to welcome Mariah Ruell as our new Executive Director and Rick Wathen as our new Director of Health and Wellness. Your presence will surely enhance the Gardens on Quail community even further!

Navigating the Journey of Dementia‍

We are offering a class for families, friends, or residents to develop a better understanding of dementia, improve communication, and learn effective approaches to caring for loved ones. Classes are held on Tuesdays from 6 pm to 7:30 pm, starting June 25th and running for five weeks. Please RSVP to Marci Gerke at mgerke@stagesenior.com as we will limit this class to 20 people.

Dementia Support Group
Date: July 9th
Time: 4:00 pm
Led by Regional Memory Care Director Marci Gerke, this group provides support, information, and a welcoming environment for those caring for loved ones with dementia.

Join us for a summer full of joy, community spirit, and heartfelt connections at Gardens on Quail!

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: July 25 Newsletter
Content:
Fireworks aren’t the only thing lighting up our skies this month—July at Gardens on Quail is positively sparkling with celebrations, adventures, and shared moments of joy! From patriotic parades to sock-hop shimmies, there’s something on the calendar for every resident, family member, and friend to enjoy.

Kick-off: A Star-Spangled Friday (July 4)

We’ll salute the red, white, and blue with a wheelchair & walker car-wash, a decorating station, and our colorful Wheelchair Parade rolling out at 2 p.m. Bring your flags, cheer on the marchers, and stay for a front-row seat to Rick Chinisci & Charlie Duo during Happy Hour at 3 p.m.

Carnival Weekend Extravaganza (Saturday, July 5)

Step right up for midway-style games, bubble socials, face painting, and classic fair treats. Laughter is guaranteed, prizes are plentiful, and memories are waiting to be made.

Feathered Friends & Scenic Drives

  • July 8 – We officially welcome new residents to our Aviary—watch as they stretch their wings and make themselves at home.
  • July 9 – Buckle up for a summertime scenic drive through the foothills. Picture windows down, mountain breezes in your hair, and that unmistakable Colorado view.
  • July 23 – Butterflies beckon! Our trip to the Butterfly Pavilion promises fluttering beauty, soft landings, and maybe a caterpillar selfie or two.

Rock Around the Clock: 1950s Sock Hop & Movie Matinee (July 14)

Pull on your poodle skirts and saddle shoes—our retro diner transforms into a rock-’n’-roll dance floor at 1:30 p.m. Malts, shakes, and jukebox jams included. Finish the afternoon with a “Dirty Dancing” matinee (because nobody puts Quail in a corner).

Creative Corners

  • Rise & Shine Mondays – Start every week with meditation, garden play, or coffee with neighbors.
  • Tasty Tuesdays – Whip up Muddy Buddies (July 15) and Cajun Nut Mix (July 29).
  • Creative Music Workshop (July 18, 1:30 p.m.) – Jam with Conor, Chef Bob, and fellow music lovers. Instruments provided—or bring your own!

Aloha, August-Eve! Hawaiian Luau (July 30)

Glowstick exercise at dawn, a tropical buffet at 11 a.m., and authentic Tehani Hula Dancers at 1:30 p.m. Cap it off with our own hula contest and Hawaiian storytelling at 2:30 p.m. Aloha attire encouraged!

Community Spotlight

Employee of the Month: Emily Stevens-Newlon
Since April, Emily’s bright smile has greeted everyone at our front desk. Whether she’s helping a resident, welcoming a guest, or supporting a teammate, Emily’s warmth sets the tone for our community. Congratulations, Emily—your excellence shines through daily!

Resident & Team Birthdays

Join us in sending heartfelt wishes to Julys’ honorees: Emile A. (3rd), Paula N. (9th), Emily Stevens-Newlon (10th), Frene Boyet (13th), Jenelyn Pinney (13th), Jose Guerrero (21st), Barabara Vinzant (22nd), and Suzanne Brodeur (31st).

Here’s to fireworks of friendship, sparks of creativity, and sunshine-filled days at Gardens on Quail!

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: June 2024 Newsletter
Content:
Get ready to dive into a month filled with sunshine, laughter, and exciting events here at the Gardens on Quail! As the days grow longer and warmer, we're thrilled to bring you a lineup of activities and celebrations that are sure to make your summer unforgettable. From our vibrant Health Fair and enchanting Summer Orchestra night to Father's Day festivities and our special Alzheimer's Awareness event, there's something for everyone to enjoy.

So grab your sun hats, bring your smiles, and let's make June a month to remember!

Upcoming Events

June 9th: Summer Orchestra

  • Time: 6:30 pm
  • Enjoy an evening of beautiful music performed by a local orchestra.

June 12th: The Gardens on Quail Health Fair

  • Time: 1:00 pm - 3:00 pm
  • Join us at the town center to meet our fantastic ancillary and caring partners.

June 14th: Father's Day Car Show with Burgers and Brews

  • Time: 10:00 am - 1:00 pm
  • Celebrate Father's Day with classic cars, delicious burgers, and refreshing brews.

June 16th: Donuts with Dads

  • Time: 10:30 am
  • Join us for a special Father's Day treat. Happy Father's Day!

June 20th: Longest Day of the Year - Alzheimer's Awareness Event

  • Time: 6:00 pm
  • Celebrate the longest day of the year with a drive-in movie and a Purple Party to raise awareness for Alzheimer's.

Resident Birthdays

  • June 1st: Joan Simms
  • June 4th: Bobby Smith
  • June 6th: Hue Norwood
  • June 10th: Carol Foster
  • June 14th: Martha Lillibridge
  • June 27th: Monica Norwood
  • June 28th: Barbara Biallas
  • June 30th: Della Dickerson

Staff Birthdays

  • June 7th: Mary Cagle
  • June 8th: Barry Borden and Victoria Hack
  • June 20th: Mia Garcia
  • June 22nd: Vanessa Valdez
  • June 24th: Cheryl Briscoe-Jones

Dementia Support Group

Date: June 11th

‍Time: 4:00 pm

Led by Regional Memory Care Director Marci Gerke, this support group is open to anyone caring for aging loved ones, especially those with dementia. Join us for support, information, and a welcoming environment to share experiences.

Welcome New Residents

A warm welcome to our newest community members: Suzanne Boudeur, Elizabeth Morgan, Larry and Ren McKenize, Sandra Webber, and Marilyn Funk.

Volunteering Opportunities

We're seeking volunteers to assist with activities, showcase musical talents, or simply spend quality time with our residents. If interested, please contact Jennie at jdreiling@gardensonquail.com.

Garden Club

Our veggie patch is officially in the ground! Join Jess every Tuesday at 11:15 am for some garden magic. Help us keep our garden thriving with watering, weeding, planting, and harvesting.

Al Fresco Dining

Summer is the perfect time to enjoy a meal outside. If you'd like to dine in our beautiful courtyard, let a server know before you go out, and we'll ensure you're taken care of.

Enjoy the sunny days and warm nights this June at Gardens on Quail. We're looking forward to all the wonderful moments we'll share together this month!

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: June 25 Newsletter
Content:
At the Gardens on Quail, June is more than just the start of summer—it's a season of celebration, creativity, and community. We're thrilled to invite residents, families, and friends to take part in a vibrant array of events that capture the spirit of togetherness and joy.

🌎 June 5 – World Environment Day
We're going green by painting recycling bins that will be placed in each neighborhood. This creative act promotes sustainability while letting residents leave their artistic mark.

🍦 Every Sunday at 3 PM – Ice Cream Socials
Join us in the Town Center for sweet treats, good company, and summer vibes.

🚗 June 14 – Father’s Day Car Show (10 AM – 1 PM)
Celebrate our Gardens Fathers with chrome, classics, and camaraderie. A community favorite!

🧑🏽‍🌾 Weekend Gardening Fun
Every Saturday and Sunday, residents can nurture our beautiful grounds by helping water the gardens—a wonderful way to connect with nature.

🧵 June 19 – Juneteenth Celebration
We’ll create a large paper quilt made from individual squares crafted by residents. Wear red in honor of the holiday and join us in reflecting on freedom and history.

🌈 June 29 – Pride Day
Show your colors and support love in all its forms! Dress in rainbow attire and celebrate unity with us.

🎨 June 12 – Tie-Dye Workshop (11 AM – 4 PM)
Peace, love, and color! Our courtyard will come alive with vibrant creations that will be sold at the Craft Fair.

🛍️ June 21 – Walk to End Alzheimer’s Craft Fair
Support a meaningful cause while shopping handmade crafts by residents and local vendors in our Town Center. All proceeds from resident crafts will benefit the Walk to End Alzheimer’s.

🍨 June 27 – Dignity Hospice Ice Cream Social (2 PM)
A sweet way to say thank you and celebrate community.

🍴 Tasty Tuesdays
June 3 – Rice Krispies Creations
June 24 – Banana Bread Baking Fun

🎶 Friday Happy Hours (3 PM)
Enjoy live music, delicious bites, and refreshing drinks every week!

  • June 6: Rick Chinisci & Charlie Duo
  • June 13: Dino on Drums
  • June 20: Bill Sucke Encore
  • June 27: Calvin the Hat Man

🎉 Celebrating Our Own
Happy Birthday to all our June babies—residents and staff alike! And a huge congratulations to our Employee of the Month, Sammi Niemeier. Your warmth and culinary creativity make every meal memorable.

This June, the Gardens on Quail is the place to be—where every event is another reason to smile, connect, and thrive.

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: March 2024 Newsletter
Content:
Spring is in the air, and Gardens on Quail is buzzing with excitement!

This March, we're celebrating community, creativity, and the joys of the season. From our Pie Bake-Off winners to a lineup of exciting events, there's something for everyone to enjoy. Join us in making this month unforgettable with festive parties, creative activities, and heartfelt gatherings. Let's celebrate together!

Pie Bake-Off Winners Announced!

‍A round of applause for our culinary artists in the Cinnamon neighborhood for winning with their Lemon Cream Pie. Thanks to our judges from Dignity Hospice, Shamrock Foods, EmpowerMe, and GTI Labs.

Exciting March Events: Join Us!

  • Oscar Party: Glam up for our Oscar Party on March 10th at 5:00 pm.
  • Memory Care Outing: Join us for lunch at Randy's on March 14th at 11:00 am.
  • New Resident Lunch-In: Welcome our new neighbors on March 14th at 12:00 pm.
  • St. Patrick's Day Party: Get festive on March 17th at 2:45 pm.
  • Paint and Sip: Unleash creativity with Tracey's Traveling Art on March 24th at 1:30 pm.
  • Easter Service: Celebrate with us on March 31st at 10:30 am.

Celebrating Our Beloved Residents and Staff

  • Resident Birthdays: Cheers to Cindy Ewing, Bill Koller, Dino DeVovellis, Dottie Eccher, Wally McDonald, Thresa Kautz, and Bill Netz.
  • Staff Birthdays: Celebrating Annette Little, Melissa Escobar, Trynadee Wilson, Josh Kavinsky, and Ebelia Arroyo.

Volunteer with Us

If you know someone or you would be Interested in volunteering for the Gardens please connect with Jennie our AL/IL Activities Director to set up a time to talk about details. We love having community volunteers to help us with activities or just to spend some one- on - one time with our residents. Email: jdreiling@gardensonquail.com

Employee Appreciation: Quail Cash

We have started an initiative at the Gardens where residents can tip employees for going above and beyond with “Quail Cash“. Employees can then redeem their cash for prizes like a day off paid. If you need quail cash the front desk has extra

Gardening Joy

We have kicked off our summer vegetable planting. We cannot wait to enjoy the fruits of our labor!

Welcoming New Residents

‍A warm welcome to our newest members. We're thrilled to have you with us. Martha Lillibridge, Bobby and Ruth Ann Smith, Peggy Hanchey, Barbara Begley, Laura Kroskob, and Diane Flora.

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: May 2024 Newsletter
Content:
A Blooming May at Gardens on Quail!

Spring has sprung, and we're blossoming with excitement for a fantastic lineup of events this May at Gardens on Quail! With vibrant celebrations, heartfelt gatherings, and plenty of opportunities to connect, we can't wait to share these special moments with you. From our festive Derby Party and Cinco de Mayo celebrations to a delightful Mother’s Day Brunch and an enchanting Tea Party, May promises to be a month filled with joy, laughter, and cherished memories. So, mark your calendars, gather your friends, and let's welcome the warmth and beauty of spring together!

Upcoming Events:

  • May 4th, 3:00pm: Run for the Roses Derby Party ​
  • May 6th, 11:00am: Cinco De Mayo Party ​
  • May 12th: Mother’s Day Brunch and Bubbles, 11:00am-1:30pm (Please RSVP by May 8th to Jennie in Activities) ​
  • May 14th, 2:00pm: Tea Party “Celebrating Women” ​
  • May 17th, 3:00pm: Happy Hour with Elvis ​
  • May 23rd, 11:15am: Memory Care Lunch Outing - The Olive Garden ​
  • May 27th, 11:30am: Memorial Day BBQ ​

Dementia Support Group: ​

  • May 14th, 4:00pm: Led by Regional Memory Care Director Marci Gerke. ​ Open to those caring for aging loved ones, especially those with dementia, providing support, information, and a welcoming environment for sharing experiences. ​

Welcome New Residents: ​

  • Della Dickerson

  • Kathleen Parrett

Employee of the Month: ​

  • Lisa Garcia: Congratulations to Lisa Garcia, our shining star for May as Employee of the Month! ​ Lisa is the ultimate activities ace, blending bravery, boundless energy, and a heart of gold to create unforgettable moments for our residents. ​

Resident Birthdays:

Author: mariah-ruell

Name: May 25 Newsletter
Content:
Celebrating Community & Spring Connections

Employee of the Month

We're delighted to recognize Fidelia as our Employee of the Month! Fidelia has been an invaluable member of our Quail family for over 10 years. Her unwavering dedication and hard work have always been evident in the way she puts the residents first, ensuring their needs and well-being are met with the utmost care. Fidelia's warm and cheerful presence brings joy and laughter to everyone around her each day. Her positive energy is truly infectious, and it has a remarkable impact on both the staff and residents alike. We are incredibly fortunate to have Fidelia as part of our team, and her contributions are deeply appreciated.

Resident Birthdays

  • Liz M - May 8th
  • Jeannine H - May 24th
  • Sue M - May 27th

Special Celebrations

Join us for a special celebration on Thursday, May 22nd at 1 pm in the Town Center, where resident Dale Ashton and his wife, Dorothy will be celebrating their 65-year wedding anniversary! Everyone is invited to help commemorate this incredible milestone.

Upcoming Community Events & Calendar Changes

Calendar Update: In an attempt to give our Wednesday Shopping Outing participants more time to shop, we have moved the Wednesday BINGO game to Tuesday afternoon at 3:00 pm.

Western Garden Project: Thursday, May 8th, we will use the morning to work on our Western Garden beds. We've invited residents to join in, and we will be ordering pizza for whoever comes to help.

Mother's Day Celebration: We will celebrate Mother's Day on Sunday, May 11th by painting and filling flower pots, followed by a delightful Tea Party at 3 pm.

EMPOWERME Fitness: Restorative care will host exercise at 10:30 am every Tuesday in May.

Park Trips: May brings trips to nearby parks to enjoy the beautiful Colorado weather. We will leave every Tuesday morning at 9:30 am & return before 10:30 am exercise.

Join us for Happy Hour! Enjoy tasty treats, refreshing drinks, and a live musical performance! Let's unwind and kick off the weekend together every Friday at 3 PM!

May Performances

  • May 2nd: Performance by Rick Chinisci and Charlie Duo
  • May 9th: Performance by Larry O'Connor on Piano
  • May 16th: Encore Performance by Rick Chinisci Duo
  • May 23rd: Performance by Dino on Drums
  • May 30th: Folk Guitar Performance with Bill Sucke

Plenty of Outings!'

We will be taking several lunch, shopping and trips to local parks in May. Here are some of the highlights:

  • Tuesday, May 13th at 9:30 am: Assisted Living will visit Majestic View Park for a relaxing outdoor excursion.
  • Thursday, May 15th: Assisted Living will be going to Breadwinners, an Olde Town Arvada favorite.
  • Wednesday, May 21st at 11:15 am: By request of one of the residents, Memory Care will be having lunch at Massino's Pizza, another local favorite!
  • Wednesday, May 28th at 12:30 pm: Memory Care will visit the Butterfly Pavilion in Broomfield.

For more information about any of these events or to RSVP, please visit the front desk. We look forward to an exciting month of activities and community connections!

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: November 24 Newsletter
Content:
November is a season of gratitude, community, and connection here at Gardens on Quail! This month, our residents and team come together to celebrate meaningful traditions, support local seniors, and share moments of joy with loved ones. We have an exciting lineup of activities, and we can’t wait to share these special times with our community.

November 1st - Día de Los Muertos Celebration at 11:15 AM‍

We’re honoring our loved ones who have passed with a beautiful Día de Los Muertos celebration. Together, we’ll create a Gardens on Quail ofrenda, a traditional altar adorned with memories and tributes to those who have touched our lives. Join us as we celebrate life, love, and legacy through this cherished cultural tradition.

November 4th - Community Gratitude Tree at 1:30 PM

‍Gratitude is in the air! We’re setting up our “Gratitude Tree,” a place where residents, families, and team members can reflect on what they’re most thankful for. Help us bring our tree to life by sharing your thoughts of gratitude. It’s a wonderful reminder of the blessings we share as a community.

November 19th - The Senior Stocking Project at 1:30 PM

‍It’s the season of giving! We’re thrilled to support the Senior Stocking Project, which provides thoughtful stocking gifts to low-income seniors, isolated individuals, and those experiencing homelessness in our community. Join us to collect and fill stockings with essential items and holiday treats. Together, we’re bringing warmth and kindness to those who need it most.

November 20th - Little Loves Preschool Visit at 10:30 AM

‍Our monthly gathering with Little Loves Preschool is back! These young friends bring laughter, creativity, and heartwarming connections to our residents. This month, the children will visit for a special activity, creating cherished moments and memories that bridge generations.

November 27th - Thanksgiving Lunch

‍This Thanksgiving, we’re celebrating with a special lunch for our residents and their families. We invite you to join us for a memorable meal, where we’ll share stories, laughter, and gratitude for the wonderful community we have at Gardens on Quail. Please RSVP by November 21st to reserve your place and ensure there’s a seat for everyone!

Honoring Amy Felperin as November’s Employee of the Month

‍Congratulations to Amy Felperin, our November Employee of the Month! Amy is the heart of our activities team, bringing contagious joy and boundless enthusiasm to our community. Her dedication shines through every event and gathering, making Gardens on Quail a vibrant and joyful place to be.

Special Invitation: Navigating the Journey of Dementia Classes - Tuesdays, 6 PM to 7:30 PM

‍This month, we’re offering a compassionate and insightful class, “Navigating the Journey of Dementia,” held every Tuesday evening. These sessions are designed to support families and caregivers as they navigate the challenges and experiences of dementia. Visit the front desk for more information and to sign up.

This November, Gardens on Quail is bustling with heartfelt celebrations, opportunities for giving, and festive gatherings. We hope you’ll join us in making this season bright for everyone in our community. Happy November to all!

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: October 24 Newsletter
Content:
As the air turns crisp and the leaves change colors, we at Gardens on Quail are excited to embrace the beautiful autumn season with a variety of engaging activities and community events. From fall festivities to celebrating our outstanding team members, there’s a lot to look forward to this month. Here’s a look at what’s happening at Gardens on Quail in October!

Employee of the Month: Congratulations, Krystal!

We are thrilled to announce Krystal as our Employee of the Month for September! Krystal shines brightly in our community, dazzling everyone with her warm heart and eagerness to lend a hand. Our residents and staff absolutely adore her dedication, and we couldn’t be more proud of her hard work and commitment. Thank you, Krystal, for all that you do—you are a true gem!

Resident Birthdays

We love celebrating birthdays here at Gardens on Quail! Join us in wishing a very happy birthday to our residents celebrating this month:

  • October 4th: Sharon H
  • October 8th: Sandy K
  • October 10th: Jack W
  • October 11th: Robin D
  • October 12th: Betty A, Connie B, Ann W
  • October 13th: Linda A
  • October 22nd: Linda B
  • October 25th: Ren M, Yvonne K

We hope your special day is filled with joy, laughter, and love!

Upcoming Events

We’ve got an exciting lineup of events planned to bring in the autumn season. Mark your calendars and join us for these fun and festive activities:

  • October 2nd: Fall Fest – Kick off the fall season with a special breakfast and lunch in Town Center as we deep clean the dining room.
  • October 11th, 2:00 PM: Oktoberfest Celebration – Enjoy traditional Oktoberfest snacks, games, polka music, and a live performance by Steve Rock!
  • October 15th, 2:00 PM: Fall Tea Party – Sip apple cinnamon tea and celebrate the changing seasons in style.
  • October 21st, 1:30 PM: Pumpkin Painting Party – Pick pumpkins from our patch and get creative while enjoying some hot apple cider.
  • October 24th, 3:15 PM: Community Chili Cook-Off – Sample delicious chili from each neighborhood and vote for your favorite!
  • October 31st: Halloween Celebrations
    • 10:30 AM: Little Loves Preschool Trick-or-Treat in Town Center
    • 1:30 PM: Halloween Party with fun games and snacks
    • 2:30 PM: Halloween Happy Hour with Dino

We’ll also be collecting Halloween candy donations throughout the month! If you’d like to donate candy for our trick-or-treat event with Little Loves Preschool, please drop it off at the box at the front desk.

Vaccination Clinic

Gardens on Quail will be holding a vaccination clinic for residents on October 23rd from 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM. If you’d like more information or need a consent form, please reach out to the front desk.

Dementia Support Group

Our monthly Dementia Support Group will be held on October 8th at 4:00 PM, led by Regional Memory Care Director Marci Gerke. This support group is open to those caring for aging loved ones, especially those with dementia, and provides a welcoming environment for sharing experiences and gaining valuable information.

Thank You for Supporting the Alzheimer’s Team!

We want to extend a heartfelt thank you to everyone who contributed to raising money for our Alzheimer’s Team. Together, we raised an impressive $23,385! A special shout-out to Andy, who ran 50 miles and raised an incredible $10,000 toward our team’s efforts. Thank you all for helping in the fight against Alzheimer’s—your generosity and dedication mean the world!

October is shaping up to be a month full of fun, support, and community spirit here at Gardens on Quail. We look forward to celebrating the season with all of you!

Stay connected with us for more updates and event announcements by following us on social media. Let’s make this October one to remember!

‍

‍
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: September 2024 Newsletter
Content:
As the leaves begin to change and the crispness of autumn fills the air, we at Gardens on Quail are excited to share all the wonderful happenings around our community this September. From honoring our incredible team members and residents to engaging in meaningful events, this month is filled with opportunities to connect, celebrate, and support important causes.

Employee of the Month: Congratulations, Allie!

We are thrilled to announce Allie as our Employee of the Month for September! Allie’s genuine kindness and eagerness to help have made her a standout at Gardens on Quail. Both residents and fellow staff members sincerely appreciate her hard work and unwavering commitment. Thank you, Allie, for all that you do to make our community a warm and welcoming place!

Resident and Staff Birthdays

We love celebrating birthdays here at Gardens on Quail! Join us in wishing our residents and staff a very happy birthday this month:

Resident Birthdays:

  • September 3rd: Sandra V
  • September 4th: Vera P
  • September 5th: John N
  • September 15th: Vivian S
  • September 22nd: Patty B
  • September 24th: Shirley B
  • September 29th: Frank S

Staff Birthdays:

  • September 7th: Janelle J
  • September 19th: Allie H
  • September 26th: Natalia H
  • September 30th: Desiree A

We hope your special day is filled with joy, laughter, and lots of love!

Upcoming Events

This September, we have a full calendar of events designed to bring our community together and create lasting memories:

  • September 8th: Official Broncos Kick-Off – Get ready to show your team spirit! We’re hosting a themed lunch followed by a kick-off party as we cheer on the Broncos in their first game of the season.
  • September 10th: First Responders Goodie Bags – After our morning exercise, join us in assembling goodie bags to honor our first responders. This is a small token of our appreciation for their dedication, especially as we remember those who lost their lives on September 11th.
  • September 21st: Walk to End Alzheimer’s – In support of the mission to end Alzheimer’s, we’re organizing a walk around our courtyard and neighborhood at 10:00 AM. Deck out in purple to show your support!
  • September 22nd: Westminster Christian Church Children's Choir Performance – Enjoy a heartwarming performance by the Westminster Christian Church Children’s Choir at 1:30 PM.
  • September 26th: Gardens Walker and Wheelchair Wash – Join us at 11:00 AM for a walker and wheelchair wash, ensuring everyone’s mobility aids are in top shape.

National Assisted Living Week: September 8th-15th

This week is dedicated to celebrating our incredible staff and residents. We have a variety of fun and engaging activities planned, including dress-up days, community BINGO, and special treats for everyone. Additionally, we’ll have a staff appreciation board in the lobby where you can leave notes of encouragement and kindness for those who make Gardens on Quail such a wonderful place to live and work.

Dementia Support Group

Supporting our residents and their families is a core value at Gardens on Quail. On September 10th at 4:00 PM, we’ll be hosting our monthly Dementia Support Group, led by Regional Memory Care Director Marci Gerke. This group is open to all those caring for aging loved ones, especially those with dementia, providing a welcoming environment for sharing experiences, gaining information, and finding support.

Join Us in Making September Special

We invite you to participate in the many events and celebrations happening this month. Whether you’re cheering on the Broncos, walking to end Alzheimer’s, or simply taking a moment to appreciate our wonderful community, there’s something for everyone this September at Gardens on Quail.

Let’s make this month one to remember!

‍
Author: mariah-ruell
